tags: i hate and get very bored in netball
summary:
me, shooting a hoop: you can call me kippen, tj kippen !!!
me, goes for another shot: 11.5 is quaking
me, goes for another shot...
body:
me, shooting a hoop: you can call me kippen, tj kippen !!!

me, goes for another shot: 11.5 is quaking

me, goes for another shot but misses: i missed but the slayer still can’t compete !!!!!

me: tyronius came here to play and he’s planning to stay

my friend tolu watching me in confusion from the corner: what the fuck is he doing, i thought you couldn’t dribble in netball????

brooke, sighing angrily and confused: y-you can’t.

tolu, laughing at my mess of a life: adhd at its finest

arifah: no this has to be the work of autism

me: *stops dead in my tracks to look at them disgusted*

me: *shruggs in agreement and carries on shooting*

blog.name: captainkippen
blog.title: you can be oblivious
blog.description: aaron • he/him • requests are open • fic masterlist • icon by simplycyrus

summary: Prompt: soulmate au. Some sort of mark/tattoo/connection with your soulmate, tyrus and whatever background ships you like 😉
question: Prompt: soulmate au. Some sort of mark/tattoo/connection with your soulmate, tyrus and whatever background ships you like 😉
answer:
SEND ME FIC PROMPTS

The night Cyrus turns fifteen he stays up until the early hours of the morning waiting for his soul mark to appear, wondering if he’ll be able to feel it come in and what it will be like if he does. It’s different for everybody; some feel their mark burning as the letters are inscribed into their skin by an invisible hand, others experience a sensation akin to soft lips pressing a gentle kiss upon them, but it’s not unusual to feel nothing at all. He must fall asleep sometime around dawn, the mark still not having appeared. He would’ve noticed if it had, he had been getting up every half an hour to check. When he wakes, groggy and confused, it’s almost noon. It takes him a moment to remember why he’s so tired, then suddenly he’s wide awake once more and leaping out of bed to inspect himself in the mirror.

A soul mark can appear anywhere on a person’s body. There are theories about the locations, a common belief is that they appear on the site of the first place your soulmate touched or will touch you. Cyrus isn’t so sure about that one because he finally finds his mark he finds it sloping lopsidedly down his left hip, and the words there are instantly recognisable.

‘You can’t get your own muffin?’

The first words TJ ever said to him. He can hear them clear as day in his mind, even the disbelieving tone rings through.

TJ. His soulmate is TJ. His first and most hysterical thought about this is that the touch theory is definitely wrong because TJ has touched Cyrus many times by now but never on his hip. They’ve knocked hands at the movie theatre fighting for popcorn from the same bucket, the wrestle regularly when TJ’s feeling especially playful, and more than once he’s had TJ wipe an eyelash from his cheekbone using the pad of his thumb.

Cyrus doesn’t know what else to do but call Buffy.

“TJ?” She repeats, voice coming out tinny and muffled through the receiver. “TJ is your soulmate? Are you sure?”

“I’m one hundred percent certain,” Cyrus confirmed. He had put the phone on speaker and was back in front of the mirror, the hem of his shirt lifted so he could run his fingers over the deep black lettering of the words. There’s a couple of moments of silence, and then Buffy voices the thought that Cyrus has been most afraid to think about properly himself.

“Then… he must know, Cy. He’s older than you, his birthday was months ago. He’ll already have his mark. Did he really never mention anything about it to you?”

“Never,” Cyrus says The awful truth is that he had spent the last few months leading up to this simultaneously wishing that TJ would turn out to be his soulmate, but also kind of hoping that he wouldn’t be because if he hadn’t said anything to Cyrus then maybe he didn’t actually have Cyrus’ words for his mark, and if Cyrus found out he was destined to be with somebody else then surely he’d be able to move on from the crush he had on him. If TJ has Cyrus’ words somewhere on him, then why hadn’t he said anything? Maybe he doesn’t want him.

“You have to talk to him,” Buffy says solemnly. “There has to be a good reason he didn’t say anything.”

Cyrus knows she’s right, she has to be, but he’s also filled with a dreadful sense of terror that speaking to TJ about this might not end well. As it turns out, he doesn’t have much of a chance to put off calling him because TJ arrives at the Goodmans’ house before Cyrus can even get downstairs to eat breakfast.

“Happy birthday,” TJ greets him, bright-eyed. He’s never this awake in the morning, so Cyrus eyes him suspiciously.

“You’re here early,” he says.

“Just thought we’d get a jump start on the celebrations.” His tone is all too casual and that’s what tips Cyrus off. The problem with knowing somebody better than you know yourself is that you can always tell when they’re lying. There are no secrets.

“The celebrations,” Cyrus echoes with a frown. He folds his arms. “So you’re not here to say… I don’t know, look at my soul mark, maybe?”

There’s a beat of tense silence as they stare at each other. Clearly sensing a storm coming, Cyrus’ parents beat a hasty retreat from the room leaving the boys stuck in a staring contest as if daring one another to look away. TJ breaks first, averting his eyes and ducking his head. Anger bubbles up inside Cyrus.

“You knew!” Cyrus explodes. “You have my words too! You knew that I’m your soulmate and you didn’t say anything!”

TJ half shrugs awkwardly. “I could never find the right time to tell you.”

“You’ve had months! We’ve spent the majority of all those months together!”

“Well, when you put it like that it sounds bad!”

“It is bad!” Cyrus shoots back, then it’s as if all the anger suddenly drains only to be replaced by fear. “Do you… do you not want to be soulmates? Is that why you didn’t say anything?”

“What?! No, Cyrus! Of course, I want to be your soulmate,” TJ sighs, running a hand through his hair nervously. “Look… you have no idea how happy I was when I realised it was you.”

“Then why didn’t you-”

“Because I was scared!”

Cyrus stares at him, mouth slightly open in surprise. The mere idea of TJ being scared by anything is laughable. He’s the most confident person that Cyrus knows. He’s TJ Kippen, the athlete with boundless confidence. Scared? There’s no way.

“What could you of all people possibly be afraid of?”

“You,” TJ answers honestly.

“I don’t understand?”

“I… I was- do we have to talk about this now? Can’t we just focus on your birthday?”

Cyrus shakes his head. “No. We have to talk about this. It’s not something we can avoid.”

“Why not?”

“Because there’s a mark etched into my hip that indicates we’re stuck together for life, TJ!”

“…it’s on your hip?”

Cyrus can’t hold back the noise of frustration he makes. “That’s what you’re choosing to focus on?”

“Right! Right, sorry,” TJ sighs again and forces himself to meet Cyrus’ eyes. “You want the truth?”

“Obviously!”

“I was afraid you wouldn’t want me.”

There’s a pause, then… “That’s ridiculous.”

“Excuse me?”

“You heard me.”

“I’m here baring my soul to you and you’re calling me ridiculous?!”

“Absolutely,” Cyrus nods firmly. “As if there’s any universe where I wouldn’t want you. I’ve been in love with you since… I don’t even know how long. Why wouldn’t I want you to be my soulmate?”

TJ looks completely gobsmacked. “You… love me?”

“Duh.”

“Oh.”

There’s a moment of awkward silence where they both look everywhere but at one another, and then TJ suddenly seems to remember something.

“I love you too,” he says. “By the way.”

Relief washes over Cyrus in a great big wave. He smiles. Boy, they’re both pretty stupid.

“Can I see your mark now?” TJ asks quietly.

“Only if I can see yours.”

“Okay,” and TJ tugs down the collar of his shirt.

‘I didn’t need this extra level of embarrassment… but no.’

The words are inscribed neatly along his collarbone in a small blocky font. Cyrus hadn’t expected the confirmation of it to affect him so much, but he finds himself having to duck his head away and pull back tears.

“Cy?” TJ’s voice is tinged with concern. “You okay?”

“I’m fine,” he replies, throat tight. “I just… I’m really happy.”

It’s true. This is the best birthday present he could’ve got, even with the shock of it all. He’s facing a lifetime of TJ by his side and he can’t imagine anything better.
answer_abstract:
SEND ME FIC PROMPTS

The night Cyrus turns fifteen he stays up until the early hours of the morning waiting for his soul mark to appear, wondering if he’ll be able to feel it come in and what it will be like if he does. It’s different for everybody; some feel their mark burning as the letters are inscribed into their skin by an invisible hand, others experience a sensation akin to soft lips pressing a gentle kiss upon them, but it’s not unusual to feel nothing at all. He must fall asleep sometime around dawn, the mark still not having appeared. He would’ve noticed if it had, he had been getting up every half an hour to check. When he wakes, groggy and confused, it’s almost noon. It takes him a moment to remember why he’s so tired, then suddenly he’s wide awake once more and leaping out of bed to inspect himself in the mirror.

A soul mark can appear anywhere on a person’s body. There are theories about the locations, a common belief is that they appear on the site of the first place your soulmate touched or will touch you. Cyrus isn’t so sure about that one because he finally finds his mark he finds it sloping lopsidedly down his left hip, and the words there are instantly recognisable.

‘You can’t get your own muffin?’

reblog.comment:
SEND ME FIC PROMPTS

The night Cyrus turns fifteen he stays up until the early hours of the morning waiting for his soul mark to appear, wondering if he’ll be able to feel it come in and what it will be like if he does. It’s different for everybody; some feel their mark burning as the letters are inscribed into their skin by an invisible hand, others experience a sensation akin to soft lips pressing a gentle kiss upon them, but it’s not unusual to feel nothing at all. He must fall asleep sometime around dawn, the mark still not having appeared. He would’ve noticed if it had, he had been getting up every half an hour to check. When he wakes, groggy and confused, it’s almost noon. It takes him a moment to remember why he’s so tired, then suddenly he’s wide awake once more and leaping out of bed to inspect himself in the mirror.

A soul mark can appear anywhere on a person’s body. There are theories about the locations, a common belief is that they appear on the site of the first place your soulmate touched or will touch you. Cyrus isn’t so sure about that one because he finally finds his mark he finds it sloping lopsidedly down his left hip, and the words there are instantly recognisable.

‘You can’t get your own muffin?’

[[MORE]]

The first words TJ ever said to him. He can hear them clear as day in his mind, even the disbelieving tone rings through.

TJ. His soulmate is TJ. His first and most hysterical thought about this is that the touch theory is definitely wrong because TJ has touched Cyrus many times by now but never on his hip. They’ve knocked hands at the movie theatre fighting for popcorn from the same bucket, the wrestle regularly when TJ’s feeling especially playful, and more than once he’s had TJ wipe an eyelash from his cheekbone using the pad of his thumb.

Cyrus doesn’t know what else to do but call Buffy.

“TJ?” She repeats, voice coming out tinny and muffled through the receiver. “TJ is your soulmate? Are you sure?”

“I’m one hundred percent certain,” Cyrus confirmed. He had put the phone on speaker and was back in front of the mirror, the hem of his shirt lifted so he could run his fingers over the deep black lettering of the words. There’s a couple of moments of silence, and then Buffy voices the thought that Cyrus has been most afraid to think about properly himself.

“Then… he must know, Cy. He’s older than you, his birthday was months ago. He’ll already have his mark. Did he really never mention anything about it to you?”

“Never,” Cyrus says The awful truth is that he had spent the last few months leading up to this simultaneously wishing that TJ would turn out to be his soulmate, but also kind of hoping that he wouldn’t be because if he hadn’t said anything to Cyrus then maybe he didn’t actually have Cyrus’ words for his mark, and if Cyrus found out he was destined to be with somebody else then surely he’d be able to move on from the crush he had on him. If TJ has Cyrus’ words somewhere on him, then why hadn’t he said anything? Maybe he doesn’t want him.

“You have to talk to him,” Buffy says solemnly. “There has to be a good reason he didn’t say anything.”

Cyrus knows she’s right, she has to be, but he’s also filled with a dreadful sense of terror that speaking to TJ about this might not end well. As it turns out, he doesn’t have much of a chance to put off calling him because TJ arrives at the Goodmans’ house before Cyrus can even get downstairs to eat breakfast.

“Happy birthday,” TJ greets him, bright-eyed. He’s never this awake in the morning, so Cyrus eyes him suspiciously.

“You’re here early,” he says.

“Just thought we’d get a jump start on the celebrations.” His tone is all too casual and that’s what tips Cyrus off. The problem with knowing somebody better than you know yourself is that you can always tell when they’re lying. There are no secrets.

“The celebrations,” Cyrus echoes with a frown. He folds his arms. “So you’re not here to say… I don’t know, look at my soul mark, maybe?”

There’s a beat of tense silence as they stare at each other. Clearly sensing a storm coming, Cyrus’ parents beat a hasty retreat from the room leaving the boys stuck in a staring contest as if daring one another to look away. TJ breaks first, averting his eyes and ducking his head. Anger bubbles up inside Cyrus.

“You knew!” Cyrus explodes. “You have my words too! You knew that I’m your soulmate and you didn’t say anything!”

TJ half shrugs awkwardly. “I could never find the right time to tell you.”

“You’ve had months! We’ve spent the majority of all those months together!”

“Well, when you put it like that it sounds bad!”

“It is bad!” Cyrus shoots back, then it’s as if all the anger suddenly drains only to be replaced by fear. “Do you… do you not want to be soulmates? Is that why you didn’t say anything?”

“What?! No, Cyrus! Of course, I want to be your soulmate,” TJ sighs, running a hand through his hair nervously. “Look… you have no idea how happy I was when I realised it was you.”

“Then why didn’t you-”

“Because I was scared!”

Cyrus stares at him, mouth slightly open in surprise. The mere idea of TJ being scared by anything is laughable. He’s the most confident person that Cyrus knows. He’s TJ Kippen, the athlete with boundless confidence. Scared? There’s no way.

“What could you of all people possibly be afraid of?”

“You,” TJ answers honestly.

“I don’t understand?”

“I… I was- do we have to talk about this now? Can’t we just focus on your birthday?”

Cyrus shakes his head. “No. We have to talk about this. It’s not something we can avoid.”

“Why not?”

“Because there’s a mark etched into my hip that indicates we’re stuck together for life, TJ!”

“…it’s on your hip?”

Cyrus can’t hold back the noise of frustration he makes. “That’s what you’re choosing to focus on?”

“Right! Right, sorry,” TJ sighs again and forces himself to meet Cyrus’ eyes. “You want the truth?”

“Obviously!”

“I was afraid you wouldn’t want me.”

There’s a pause, then… “That’s ridiculous.”

“Excuse me?”

“You heard me.”

“I’m here baring my soul to you and you’re calling me ridiculous?!”

“Absolutely,” Cyrus nods firmly. “As if there’s any universe where I wouldn’t want you. I’ve been in love with you since… I don’t even know how long. Why wouldn’t I want you to be my soulmate?”

TJ looks completely gobsmacked. “You… love me?”

“Duh.”

“Oh.”

There’s a moment of awkward silence where they both look everywhere but at one another, and then TJ suddenly seems to remember something.

“I love you too,” he says. “By the way.”

Relief washes over Cyrus in a great big wave. He smiles. Boy, they’re both pretty stupid.

“Can I see your mark now?” TJ asks quietly.

“Only if I can see yours.”

“Okay,” and TJ tugs down the collar of his shirt.

‘I didn’t need this extra level of embarrassment… but no.’

The words are inscribed neatly along his collarbone in a small blocky font. Cyrus hadn’t expected the confirmation of it to affect him so much, but he finds himself having to duck his head away and pull back tears.

“Cy?” TJ’s voice is tinged with concern. “You okay?”

“I’m fine,” he replies, throat tight. “I just… I’m really happy.”

It’s true. This is the best birthday present he could’ve got, even with the shock of it all. He’s facing a lifetime of TJ by his side and he can’t imagine anything better.

blog.name: my-ao3feed-trial
blog.title: ao3feed trial
blog.description: just a blog where I try to figure out how to set an ao3feed

summary: Frick
title: Frick
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2RyJw4V

by SunnyMmtree

TJ Kippen and Cyrus Goodman had been dating since they were high school students, and now that Cyrus was a senior in college and TJ a college graduate they were settled in life. However, when Cyrus’s exams and TJ’s job create a time conflict things get a little unsettled, and TJ gets a little… desperate.

Just two boys in love with each other.

Words: 1889, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Andi Mack (TV)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Cyrus Goodman, T. J. Kippen
  • Relationships: Cyrus Goodman/T. J. Kippen
  • Additional Tags: Fluff, Light Angst, Alternate Universe - Future, Near Future, Boys Kissing, Neck Kissing, Nicknames, Aged-Up Character(s)


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2RyJw4V

by SunnyMmtree

TJ Kippen and Cyrus Goodman had been dating since they were high school students, and now that Cyrus was a senior in college and TJ a college graduate they were settled in life. However, when Cyrus’s exams and TJ’s job create a time conflict things get a little unsettled, and TJ gets a little… desperate.

Just two boys in love with each other.
